title: Woman's sister reveals to her about her infidelity, woman then tells brother-in-law about the affair: 'I couldn’t just sit back and watch Tom live a lie'
description: We've all kept secrets for our siblings. Whether that be covering for them when they sneak out of the house or fixing mom's broken vase before she gets home so no one gets in trouble; sibling solidarity is one of the firmest bonds we can have. That said, we've also all tattled on a sibling in a moment of weakness. Younger siblings are known to be the bigger tattlers since they remain in the light of our parent's affection for much longer. It's always an advantage to be the baby of the family, even if you're stuck at home the longest while everyone else gets to leave.Once we reach adulthood, the instinct to tattle on our siblings mostly washes away. Sibling solidarity, however, remains forever. I know I would help my sister with anything, no questions asked. However, there are some things in life that are hard to forgive. One woman is in a tough position with her sister after her sister confides in her about her infidelity. She comes to Reddit to ask for advice after she reveals the family secret. Would you have spilled in this situation? Or is this a subject that's better left to the parties involved to deal with?
author: Baiz Hoen
